intro: Calpocalyx letestui, commonly known as the Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calpocalyx letestui is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
